title: College sports: UW-Whitewater adds Tom Klawitter as assistant baseball coach
text:
Buy Now JOHN HART -- State Journal 
Janesville Parker head coach Tom Klawitter encourages his team during the first half of a Big Eight Conference game against Verona at Verona High School in Verona, Wis. Friday, Jan. 30, 2015.John Hart -- State Journal 
Former Janesville Parker girls basketball coach Tom Klawitter has been named an assistant coach for the University of Wisconsin-Whitewater baseball team, UW-Whitewater head coach John Vodenlich said in a statement this week. 
Klawitter, a Janesville native and former professional baseball player, will work with the Warhawksâ€™ pitching staff. 
Klawitter was a professional baseball player for six years. He pitched for the Minnesota Twins during the 1985 season, appearing in seven games and pitching 9 1/3 innings. He also pitched in the Toronto Blue Jays and Los Angeles Dodgers organizations during his career. 
After that, Klawitter was as a physical education teacher in the Janesville School District for 27 years. He retired from teaching following the 2014-15 school year. 
He was head girls varsity basketball coach for 26 years. He led Janesville Parker to 16 conference championships and 12 WIAA state tournament berths, including three state championships and two runner-up finishes. Klawitter finished his career 564-128 (.815 win percentage). 
He was not given the opportunity to reapply for his position following retirement, as Parker hired Jennah (Burkholder) Hartwig as the new coach in July. She was a former Parker standout and was an assistant to Klawitter. 
Klawitter also was an assistant for the Parker baseball team. He also was an assistant varsity baseball coach from 1986-88 and 1998-2005 at Janesville Craig. 
During that time, the Cougars claimed six conference titles and a state championship in 1998. Klawitter also coached Babe Ruth Baseball teams and was a player/manager for the Janesville Aces of the Rock River Baseball League (semi-pro). He was inducted into the Wisconsin State Baseball League Hall of Fame in 2008. 
Klawitter played baseball at UW-La Crosse from 1976-80, serving as captain during the 1980 season. He helped the Eagles reach the NCAA Division III Tournament in 1979. 
After earning his bachelor's in physical education and health education from UW-La Crosse in 1986, Klawitter received his master's in professional development.
